website_summaries.verdict: A well constructed play stand that allows you to charge and play at the same time.
pros: Made from a quality, sturdy plastic, the Hori stand holds the switch snugly in place
Bottom rubber grips ensure the stand won't slide around
With plenty of ventilation, the Switch won't overheat while in the stand
You can easily access the charging ports while in the stand as well
cons: Unfolding the stand from storage to play mode is a delicate process and takes some getting used to

customer_reviews.title: A necessity if you intend to play on an airplane
customer_reviews.text: Compact and lightweight, definitely serves its purpose. If you plan to use your Switch on an airplane (the absolute best place to play a Switch, by the way), I think a stand like this is basically a requirement. It's ten times better than playing in handheld mode, using the flimsy integrated kickstand, or trying to get the screen to the right viewing angle some other way. My only complaint is that I wish it would lock in position, since it can be easy to nudge it with your hand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Wont use it all the time but for the price and compactness. 5/5
customer_reviews.text: Super compact and lightweight. Feels cheap. But is definitely capable of holding your switch firm and steady. No rocking when playing with volume,power,removing game cartridges, stand locks Switch into place so it cant slide out left or right. Multitude of different viewing angles. And best of all can charge your switch
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: A tad expensive for what it is, but it does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to complain about here, it's plastic and hinges. It holds the switch and has all the right cutouts and stuff for the cords/vents. It has notches to give it different viewing angles. My only gripe is that I expected it to be closer to the 8-10 dollar range, as it's only plastic, but I think it's still worth the price compared to other options. It works great with the Mumba case, which means it'll probably fit most any case, and it's thin enough to fit in bigger carrying cases. It's nice for playing desktop while charging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for the nintendo switch and this one is the best, it has air vents where the fans are ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few of stands for the nintendo switch and this one is the best, it has air vents where the fans are and its tall enough for the USB C cable to plug into.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Switch or plan on getting one this is a must buy. Yeah the Switch has a kick stand that you can use. And it does an ok job on hard surfaces. But sometimes it isn't as sturdy as you want it to be. This stand is perfect for if you want to charge while playing. Have it up higher for better viewing. Plus you can sit the stand on any surface and just relax and enjoy a good game. I had to wait for 2 months until it was available again. But it was worth the wait and happy that I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: MecaMe

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was going to get a cheap piece of plastic stand. I was right but it actually works very well. Fits nice and snug even with the protective case on.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy and well designed
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to be using your Switch a lot in tabletop mode, this comes in handy since you can plug a charger in while you play. It feels sturdy, they had the foresight to include holes for the Switch's vents, and best of all it folds down into a very compact block. It easily fits into a clamshell type case like the. Mine was backordered, but it was well worth waiting for.
customer_reviews.author: wightlight

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, flimsy and cheaply made product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this had such a high rating. I am incredibly disappointed in HORI, and ashamed of Nintendo for officially licensing this product. These two names are the main reason I bought this stand with confidence. It is cheaply made and does not hold the nintendo switch well at all, as the slightest movement will make it fall. There are no locks in place to hold the back piece in place and I have gotten close to completely dropping my switch off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Works with more than the switch!
customer_reviews.text: Great Item! It's strong enough I can use it with my full sized iPad 4 with a case on it! I don't have the switch yet but I'm sure it'll work great with that too. I can easily use it with the iPad Air my sister has and my 3DS XL. It's very compact and easily fits in my pocket but not so well in the switch case I have which is the sheikah slate case from the Breath of the Wild special edition. Great product definetely recommend great price!
customer_reviews.author: table356420

customer_reviews.title: HORI knows
customer_reviews.text: I trust HORI products. It's been solid. This stand is great for Zelda fan. I had to have it. Only thing I was worried about was that it only has 3 angles but it's absolutely fine. I previously purchased a stand from INSIGNIA, which is not a bad product at all. It had a stopper to secure the switch from the top and kind of sandwich it from the top and bottom. Over time, it became super annoying to open it up and close... So HORI version is more simple and straight forward and like it better.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for table top, and switch lite
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Just what I needed. I like watching shows on my TV and I don't want to always hold my switch. Looking down all the time isn't good for your neck anyways. So I went looking for a stand and after reading reviews I ordered this one. And it way exceeds my expectations. Its sturdy, has several angles so I can adjust the angle. The lip that the switch sits on has a nice wide gap for you to plug your switch in for powered play. This is allowing me to play hours of animal crossing without having to dock my switch. If you have a switch lite you need this in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: Small, portable and adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: Just like the title says, it's small and slim enough to carry with you. Not only does it work to hold your switch while you charge it, but you can also plug in your wired controller to it and play it tabletop without having to remove the controllers from your own game. Especially in my case where I find it a drag to remove the case of my switch. Highly recommended it, especially if you're going for the Legend of Zelda theme, it looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Tachinator

customer_reviews.title: It's nothing more than a plastic stand but its a good one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because frankly the kickstand on the switch frustrates me. I primarily play on my TV or a computer monitor via dock but when I play tabletop mode I really like this stand. Now I paid 13 bucks for a piece of plastic. That's all this is. But the three varying angles are a great touch and it's way more sturdy than the kickstand. If you're on a limited budget this accessory belongs no where near the top of your "must have" accessories list. But if you're the kind of person that thinks 13 bucks isnt too much money to upgrade a major problem on an other wise fantastic gaming system, this is a worthy buy.
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but a little cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so I could play my switch at a bit of a distance without having to dock it. It works good, and I like the options for the different angles it gives you. It's compact and not too expensive, but it's just a bit flimsy. It's very top heavy at especially the steepest angle. It makes it real easy to tip over if you hit the switch. It still works really well, and you can charge it while in the stand!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Soriano

customer_reviews.title: I used this for awhile, but the little flip-out ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for awhile, but the little flip-out piece that actually holds the Switch eventually wouldn't stay attached; kept popping off after a minute or two. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Officially licensed product by Nintendo! Perfect condition, easily transportable
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, folds flat for taking with you, cradles the switch screen perfectly as well as it has rubber corners so the switch is not loose or wobbly at all! Easily keep it charged too with cut outs for your cables. Is actually WAY nicer than just using the built in switch kickstand, which is only on 1 side of the console and has tipped over on me numerous times.. also, my switch has a case on it, and does not get in the way!
customer_reviews.author: Kae

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Great for the switch. I was using a different stand before and I hated the fact that I couldn't charge the switch without removing it from the stand. This ones is made so that it can be charged while on the stand, so it fixed my problem. I dropped it a voupke time already (oops) but it hasn't broken. Happy with purchase. Only thing that would make it even better is if it had a way to lock it in place once you decide which of the 3 tilt settings you want your switch to be at but it's not a big deal, I still like it and it fixed my problem.
customer_reviews.author: GBB113

customer_reviews.title: Great Design & Function.
customer_reviews.text: I've found that this works better than the included kickstand that is built-in to the Switch. The stand allows the Switch to be displayed at three different angles, and it holds the Switch fairly securely. The design of the stand also allows the Switch to be plugged-in and charged while playing too. When not in use, this stand can be folded and placed in your Switch carry case. I've also like that this can be a nice display stand, making it easy to grab-and-go, and also display on my desk with my other devices--when it's not docked. I liked this so much that I ordered a second one for my other Switch too.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R.Top Contributor: Action Figures

customer_reviews.title: Should have never bothered with the others....
customer_reviews.text: I tried two different stands before coming to this one, because this was out of stock for quite a while. Boy, do I regret not simply waiting for this thing. It would have spared me a lot of annoyance and hassle. This thing is great. It's sturdy, has all the features you want from a simple, inexpensive stand...and is nice and compact to carry around in a bag or a pouch. Order it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ritzen

customer_reviews.title: It will make you love your switch more
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my switch and wanted to enjoy my games without having to hold the device every time. I found this item on video that recommended this to make your playing more enjoyable. I'm so glad I purchaced it. Now I use it everyday. It works so much better than the kickstand on the device. You get different adjustments so you can have it sit perfectly for your gaming. Once u get this you will be wondering how you ever played without it comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Conley

customer_reviews.title: An Honest Review
customer_reviews.text: This product holds the nintendi switch but doesn't do as much as you think. It only gives 2 spots to set you stand at and doesn't have any other option other then that. The product also is made out of a super cheap hard plastic and weights nothing. Cheaply made! It holds your Nintendo Switch but feels like it could break with someone bumping it a little too hard. A terrible product and waste of money. It is only worth $4.99 at the most! Terrible product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brodstier

customer_reviews.title: Will it hold up time will tell....IT WILL HOLD!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 12/25/19: Still have mine an use it on a regular basis. I bought two more for Christmas gifts. UPDATE: 7/6/19: I use it pretty much everyday but not for my Switch (I still use it for that too) but for my cell phone and wireless keyboard! I love, love, love it! A must have. I got it just when it said it would be here. It works the way it is supposed to. It is a little cheap feeling though. I guess I expected something a little sturdier to hold something I've spent entirely way too much money one. But I'll update in a month on how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: We love this stand!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this stand from the moment I saw it. Then I bought the Mumba case that doesn't allow the kickstand to work, so I ended up having a reason to buy it. My son uses it for tabletop mode or watching YouTube. It's also great if you are charging the Switch or if you are playing with a wired remote. This stand is cute, simple, and folds flat enough to go in our Mumba case with the Switch and charger.
customer_reviews.author: Tomolly

customer_reviews.title: HORI does it again!
customer_reviews.text: HORI does no wrong even with devices you never know you needed. This stand is pretty much a super deluxe kickstand on the best kind of steroids. Mario branding just makes it super high quality in addition to the excellent build quality. If you find yourself moving from room to room, I highly suggest this as a compact device you can fold and take about your house.
customer_reviews.author: David Hanna

customer_reviews.title: A perfect portable Nintendo Switch stand
customer_reviews.text: A perfect little handy item for the Nintendo Switch, it can be adjusted to 3 angles. When the Switch is placed horizontally you can charge the console without issue since the bottom port is fully accessible. I like that the Switch does not heat up as it does with the stand it brings, the air vents on the back are not covered i'm using it with a USB C to HDMI to play in my 40 inch TV. Love it
customer_reviews.author: E. Almanzar

customer_reviews.title: Solution to mobile switch with a controller!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! My joycons drift so I've moved to a controller, but using the switch mobily while doing so can be a pain. The back flip of the switch itself is loose as well, so it falls on its own. This has completely solved that problem. Perhaps a little flimsier than you would expect, I'd like to see a locky mechanism on the positions for this, but otherwise great. I can get a little confused when i close it all up but it's easy to set up once you pull it apart. The stand lets you set muiltiple heights/angles an is perfect for charging the switch while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Plaptor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, tablet stands work better
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Not really compact, and kinda a pain to open up whenever I'm on the go. I was hoping for it to pop open easily and quickly like one would do with the inbuilt stand, but here you need to open it up, pull out the back, pull out the base for the switch, and then line perfectly the grooves for the switch. The case when folded up is as big as the switch itself, so it's really only compact by the standards of the switch already being portable.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowfoX

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: The HORI stand does everything I expected it to do. I got it to accommodate a Nintendo Switch that I just received, and I have no complaints. If you are not sure about it, I would recommend YouTube review videos, as they can provide some guidance. I'm posting pictures of the stand in action, from above and from the side. Again, I've no complaints. The Super Mario Bros. theme is quite vibrant, too.
customer_reviews.author: A.V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - works while plugged in, too
customer_reviews.text: The graphics on it look great, but most importantly, it is very helpful when playing in table-top mode. There are rubber pads on the bottom to keep it in place even if you're in a car or plane. There are 3 settings to adjust the angle. I'm very satisfied with the fact that the console can be plugged in while using this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great simple product that makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: Great, simple, and works well. I usually use my switch in tabletop mode, and this stand was worth it for me. I was recently using this stand to play a game while sitting on a chair and the system on the bed, and it's better than propping the system against some books or on top of books. I also use it on my desk as a dock for my cellphone when the switch is away. I'd say its worth the price, it may be a small difference but it will add up. I am able to fit the stand into my extended switch case while also carrying a charger and extra remotes so its ability to fold is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin

customer_reviews.title: Must have Accessory!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, has an opening for your cable so that you can charge your switch as you use it. It is compact and light with nice rubber feet to keep it in place. It also has rubber where the switch sits, keeping it from sliding around. I used it on a plane trip recently and its so much comfortable to play with a controller not attached, and easier on the neck and back not looking down but to look forwards at the system.
customer_reviews.author: Hiepnotiq

customer_reviews.title: This travel stand is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than what I thought but this absolutely works for me! Got this to have in another room so I could quit unplugging cables and carrying the original dock around. It will be even better when I travel in the future cause this is a pick up and go situation. And the little padding is a plus. My set up is now complete! This is great! Packaging was good so no complaints there. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Luis M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Used everyday for almost 3 years now!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this stand since December 2017, and it's been used everyday since we bought it! It's great for the switch, any tablet, or phone! I like to use it to prop my tablet or phone up and watch movies while I cook or wash dishes even! This comes apart easily to clean and snaps back together easily as well!
customer_reviews.author: JessaNae

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: For my setup it is a MUST HAVE. It is simple and does exactly as described and as you would expect. You can charge the switch while on the stand because of a hole just made for it. Is a great addition for a setup where you use an extender cable instead of docking the switch (there have been reports of screens being scratched when docking and un-docking the switch)
customer_reviews.author: Raul Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says it does!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does.... For the price another essential for any Nintendo switch owner who wishes to travel and plug their switch in on the go such as on your work desk. I have not brought my switch to work, but this would be perfect if I did!! The only down side is the kick stand does not lock in place, so one could knock the kickstand down by accident. To add one would add to the complexity and probably the price. So for the low price of this product I have no complaints as it does what it says it does and it is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Styx_Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great portable stand.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable switch stand. However, I gave it to my wife to use for her ipad while she bakes and watches movies or videos. I was going to use this for my Nintendo Switch but it does not work for my needs. Does not fit a Switch with a Satisfye grip installed. Otherwise, 5/5 stars on build and being what the product describes itself as being.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap look up Power A
customer_reviews.text: For little or same price Power A offers a much better stand. The build of this feels really cheap and the mario STICKER is cringe to the touch and i cannot imagine it would stay looking the same after a couple of months. given that Power A offers much more attractive options I can not reccomend this product unless it is a last resort.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for your Switch!
customer_reviews.text: I love playing my games on this kickstand. It takes some getting used to on how to unfold it from storage to user mode; however, it is so much better than relying on the seemingly breakable kickstand that is embedded within the switch. It's not expensive, and will keep you from breaking the kickstand on your switch. It actually looks pretty cool with the switch logo imprinted on the front of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: LOVEIT!
customer_reviews.text: so compact. so stable. and the best part is the usb-c cable can run through these gaps in it and into the bottom of the Switch, making for a perfectly streamlined stand
customer_reviews.author: TAC

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Values on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Nintendo Switch stands as an alternative to some of the much more expensive stands out there, particularly those in retail stores, and I was not disappointed. Even when I'm using my Switch in bed, this stand has not fallen over, which surprises me given the fairly low profile of the product overall. Can't recommend this stand enough, I carry it with me everywhere I go! Don't be fooled into thinking this product is flimsy out of the box given its size and weight, it's held up for nearly a year for me so far, and I don't expect it to go anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Naveen Sooknanan

customer_reviews.title: The missing Nintendo Switch stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play my Switch without having to hold up the relatively heavy handheld console the entire time and it did not disappoint. The build quality is what I expect out of a Nintendo product, so HORI has definitely taken the effort to select its materials carefully. It's compact in the sense that you can take it wherever you go, and it's certainly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I have a hard case on my Switch and cannot use the dock, unless I remove the case. I can say that my Switch fits perfectly on this stand with the Mumba case for Nintendo Switch, [Heavy Duty]...
customer_reviews.author: forcie270

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's great. It's got tiny rubber pads on it to keep the switch from sliding around on the stand, and it's got rubber pads on the bottom to keep the stand from sliding around on your desk. It has the same kinda feel as the 3DS stand if you had one of those, but this is constructed and designed better. It has holes for the wire to plug in from behind the stand so it's out of the way. It has three positions that let you set the switch at different angles. And at least on MY bed I am able to set it up to use the switch while loafing around. It's added much luxury to my switch-playing.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Loved it more then I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: Better then I thought! Fits the lite and normal switch. Charges with no issues, the stand has 3 different playing levels. Perfect for tossing it to charge or playing with a controller. Highly recommend for the price and for the convenience. Definitely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Momma🌸

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Functional
customer_reviews.text: This product feels durable and is adjustable for a couple viewing angles. The stand has little bulges where it contacts the Switch on the bottom which keeps it from sliding around. The charging port is unobstructed and there isn't any design flaws that stand out to me. The product is fold-able into a flat portable sheet which is great for travel. I've been using it mostly as a stand to play/charge when I'm not docked to TV. Note that this product is NOT a dock to connect the Switch to a TV. It is simply as advertised, a well designed playstand that does its job well in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Li Zeng

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt feel flimsy and looks nice with the switch
customer_reviews.text: Folds down compact, does its job well as a stand. It doesnt feel flimsy and looks nice with the switch. Now can you get one for cheaper? Amazon has one that I assume is same quality and will work just as well and sometimes the price will be half of this one. However at the time of buying this stand, they were just 1 dollar apart Since its just 1 dollar difference I went with this as theres a logo on this version. Just aesthetic reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Great Angles!
customer_reviews.text: It was so annoying playing with the console on the table and awkwardly looking at it or holding it all day which makes my hands cramp. So say goodbye to neck pains and hand cramps because this is perfect for gaming all day with the Switch! I can't believe I didn't buy this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this has such grand reviews. I ordered this at the request of my kiddos. After checking reviews, I went ahead and got it. It holds the switch but not well. There is no way to lock it in place and it doesn't hold it very well. A slight bump into it and its falling off and you can hope it doesnt break :/
customer_reviews.author: Amber Beach

customer_reviews.title: I love it! ... And so does my toddler!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as a way to give my hands a break from holding my switch, but since then it has also become a good stand for my child's tablet so that she can watch netflix on it when we would travel to her therapy appointments before swapping to online video calls.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Messina

customer_reviews.title: Great for Parties when you can't set up the Dock
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be able to play it in tabletop mode while it charges. It was designed very well. There are four rubber grips on the bottom to prevent it from sliding about as well. And there two on the face to prevent the switch from sliding along with grips to line it up on the stand. Ultimately it became useful because it was no longer restricted to the single angle or limited battery life. So now at parties and before class I can set this up and play some mario kart or dragonball fighterz with friends.
customer_reviews.author: Hydragon

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing! Multiple uses!
customer_reviews.text: Guys I love this thing I’ve been using it for other things too like for zoom calls and watching movies! Ha great product we bring it everywhere with us when traveling to family and great use during corona! Durable and hasn’t broke and my hubby is hard on stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Heberling

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well with the switch, since it's obviously designed to work with the device. We have also used it to set an amazon tablet in a kid case on. The basic design lets it hold other devices. It folds flat and it's a bonus that you can use a charger while using it. It keeps my son from tearing up our chargers. I think I paid around $12.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: High quality and holds the switch well. It has ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality and holds the switch well. It has notches on the base that holds the switch in place, rubber bumpers to avoid scratching and rubber feet so it won't slide. Folds up to a size very comparable to the Switch itself
customer_reviews.author: Phil Bornemann

customer_reviews.title: Works but is not great
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. I got what I payed for. I dont feel like it is as sturdy as it should be because the piece that holds it up easily folds in. When I go to pick up my switch on the stand I have to do so carefully because it the stand will collapse. It does its job but I wouldnt move it around too much It is just to flimsy for that.
customer_reviews.author: SEC

customer_reviews.title: Getting your money's worth
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting to like this stand too much since I thought I'd be using the dock to play on my TV or using the kickstand on the back of the console. But the kickstand on the switch is not really good and you can't charge at the same time. With this stand, you can charge and play with your switch. The best part is, you can put your switch on this stand with cases such as the crystal clear case or skull and co grip case. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Hori quality!
customer_reviews.text: In my experience Hori always makes quality products and this simple stand, while not as cheap in cost as other stands, does its job and does it well. Easily collapsible and lightweight it helps my Switch stay stable out of the dock. While it doesn't charge the Switch nor does it connect it to my TV, it works excellent with my Dock extender. Combining the two I can insure that my Switch has proper ventilation when not in handheld mode.
customer_reviews.author: Mord13th

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and construction
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for charging off the dock or using when traveling. Good quality construction and I love the Zelda graphics. Especially love the indent that locks the Switch into a centered position taking advantage of the nook behind the charger port, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Couch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect switch stand
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt expecting this stand to be as great as it is. It folds flat and fits in my switch case perfectly, has multiple angles to hold the switch up, and even has little divots to make sure the switch stays put on the little ledge. Perfect for anyone wanting to use the switch tablet while also needing to charge it, much better and more stable than the kick stand on the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stand
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this stand when I first received it, but I really enjoy it now. A wider base would be nice (It's only stable on a flat surface, doesn't work very well in your lap unless it's on top of something flat like a large book), but the size makes perfect sense; it fits inside switch cases and isn't bigger than the switch. I dropped it a couple times and the pieces separated, but they snapped right back together without any issues. Has room for the switch charging cable, and doesn't block the vents so your switch won't overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Switch's kickstand
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand on the Switch may be great for Tabletop play, but this compact playstand literally kicks it up a notch. The best thing about this is that I can charge my Nintendo Switch while playing in Tabletop Mode while using the Switch's kickstand alone will not let you do so as the charger must be connected underneath the console. Most importanly, I can adjust the level of height with this compact stand, and THAT is a plus for me. I couldn't be anymore happier with this product. Whoever wishes to play in Tabletop Mode more often should get this.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, compact, works well. Excellent stand for Switch
customer_reviews.text: Works well, lightweight, compact. Raises the Switch to a comfortable viewing height, holds it securely, and provides plenty of access to plug the power cord or a battery into the bottom of the Switch. I did somehow manage to knock the supports on the back of the stand off their perch once, causing the stand to collapse on itself. I'm not sure how this happened, but the Switch didn't get damaged in the process, so all's well. Just be careful that you don't knock the supports over like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Best option for handheld mode
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stand to have to play on tabletop mode. Plus you can also charge it while playing unlike if you were to use the regular stand on the back of the switch there was no way to stick the plug for charging because it's on the bottom. This fixes that and overall a better stand for the switch. It's also very small and compact that you can carry this thing everywere. It's also multi-use for basically anything that can hold it, even yes your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.Top Contributor: Anime

customer_reviews.title: Great at holding up a Switch while charging it!
customer_reviews.text: I still can’t figure out how Nintendo could put the cord port on the bottom of the Switch but this item helps overcome that issue. It also works well at holding up my phone. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hubbell

customer_reviews.title: Does what it promises
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy play stand was exactly what I was looking for and this is it. Looks good on my desk and packs flat for easy travel. I'm able to play while charging and have it standing up at a few different angles. Much better than the kickstand built in.
customer_reviews.author: KiyoshiTheKidd

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing isn't really sturdy or stand that well. The slightest bump and it'll topple over or fall flat. I spent $1 more and purchased a different stand that is MUCH sturdier and holds way better.
customer_reviews.author: allie

customer_reviews.title: A New Addition to My Accessory Kit
customer_reviews.text: This handy little stand is much more sturdy than the Switch's little kickstand with the benefit of elevating it so I can charge it. Seeing as I had bad luck with the official charging stand not actually charging during play time, this has been my go-to ever since. The surprisingly nice Zelda decorations is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kishi

customer_reviews.title: Easily a well-made purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had heard stories about how the official Switch dock can scratch the screen, and even cause the Switch to overheat, potentially warping it if you play for extended periods of time with graphically-intensive games like Zelda BotW or Xenoblade Chronicles 2. This negates both of those possibilities, and even allows me to charge/dock my Switch with my case on it, something the official dock cannot do due to the size of the case.
customer_reviews.author: GuyInDogSuit

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great, and is a must-have for any Switch owner. It folds up pretty thin (about 1.5cm thick), has three angles to adjust to, rubber insets and pegs to stabilize Switch on the 'shelf', and best of all, it allows the Switch to charge. If portability if of utmost importance to you, consider this stand. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Carbon Neutral

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Needed an easy, portable stand. This one is great. Fits inside a basic carrying case and the adjustable angle is very helpful. Have only had it a couple weeks and it seems like it might not last forever, but at the low price, I don’t mind buying a new one each year.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica James

customer_reviews.title: Little set table dohecky for switch.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loved it worked out great for him for what he needed it for ^.^ (so he can lay in bed and play it on hes litttle table when i watch my tv shows) but all in all it fits wonderful and dosnt fallback which we thought it might so that was nice pluse its zelda so when when for it too! Due mind i never played the system so dont know if i even headline this right lol due to iam a playstation fan more ^.^;;
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Makes cable twist at awkward angle
customer_reviews.text: Seems great and does everything advertised, except that it required the charging cable to be twisted more than 90 degrees. Not sure if this will damage the cable over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoosled

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product, and useful accessory.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand, it's extremely helpful to play and charge at the same time. The only thing I would change is making an adjustment in between the second and last adjustment points. It folds up compactly for storage, I've dropped it and it can just be popped right back into place. Great buy for your Switch!
customer_reviews.author: TKD

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made I am not happy with this dollar store stand. I am afraid to put my switch on this thing the stand do not lock and any little bump of the table and the stand collapse and bye bye Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Donnell Watson

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This stand works great for the Nintendo switch. HORI did a great job paying attention to detail. The stand has two notches on the shelf (similar to the Nintendo switch dock) to keep the switch secure and the base of the stand is very sturdy. It is fairly difficult to tip this stand over. The grips on the base also keep the stand from sliding at all. This stand also allows you to charge the switch while using it which is something the kickstand on the switch does not allow. I also find myself using this stand for my smart phone for watching videos. I would highly recommend this stand if you are looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph O

customer_reviews.title: Rickety and Falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: The product all in all is very cheaply made, and not sturdy in the slightest. It falls apart too easily, and barely holds my Nintendo switch. All in all this is not worth the $13 when they seemed to put less than a dollars worth of effort into this.
customer_reviews.author: Genie Earley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you want to play and charge at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: One night my daughter and I wanted to play a game on her switch but it needed to be charged. Because the connection is at the bottom we had to prop it up on a box so we could play while the thing charged but it kept falling over. I saw this holder fir about $12 and it’s a perfect and cheap solution! Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ken From OC

customer_reviews.title: Now it's much easier to play touch-based games
customer_reviews.text: I got that so that I could play games like VOEZ and Piczle Lines DX (games that are easier to play touchscreen) in handheld mode. It works exactly as intended, and I am very happy with it. The only downside is that there is nothing that grips the switch in place, you just set it down. It's not flimsy at all, and I'm not afraid of it falling over or something, but it would be nice to have that extra security. WAY better than the switch's kickstand. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but Useful
customer_reviews.text: The stand itself looks nice, but it feels as cheap as it costs. It's also bulkier than you'd think, even when flattened. I ended up getting a small first-party stand that was $20 but way sturdier and super portable.
customer_reviews.author: Where Are My Droids?

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and gets a job done.
customer_reviews.text: Works great just like the first one I got when they first started making these. The reliable and they get the job done. Only decided to replace my two year old original model because it's solid black and I would like a stand with a little more color in detail like this one.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little travel stand
customer_reviews.text: Folds tiny enough to fit in the smaller carrying cases. It's got easy access to ports for USB-C and speakers. Good air flow for the system. Highly recommend this perfect little travel stand. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E.

customer_reviews.title: A functional stand, but lacking just a little
customer_reviews.text: It's a stand for the Switch. It's functional and works, but is very light and the Switch doesn't really sit securely on it (slides of you touch it). But it does what it sets out to do, and that's be a stand for the Switch. I just think that a little rubber on the part where the Switch sets in would have gone a long way. But don't be afraid to buy it. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Giles

customer_reviews.title: A Practical Solution to the Switch's One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: There is only one real flaw that bugs me about the Nintendo Switch and that is the ridiculously weak kickstand. This product solves the problem perfectly. It is slim, simple to use and holds the Switch in place perfectly. Highly recommended for all Switch owners.
customer_reviews.author: Ismail Kamdar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect desktop or traveling companion
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I bought this just to have it sit under my computer monitor so I can still play my Switch while having it plugged in. You can fo some fancy cable routing too that, while tight, basically makes this perfect for use on a confined space. Also great for traveling
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Portable Flat Folding Stand with Vent Cutouts
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good portable compact stand for the Nintendo Switch that folds down flat. It holds the Switch securely and, unlike some other stands out there, this one comes with cutouts for the vents on the rear of the Switch so it can "breathe" and allow for air circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Kim

customer_reviews.title: Supports the Switch while you charge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could play my Switch while charging. This does just that. It's made 100% out of plastic, so it's nothing fancy, but does what it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Harp

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Plastic is a bit flimsy and falls down sometimes but it works fine. I actually use it as a nightstand for my phone too, sometimes. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace E.

customer_reviews.title: Just a plastic stand
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with it, and it's exactly what my son wanted for playing on the switch screen with the controllers removed. He now has something to set it on any surface instead of using the kick stand.
customer_reviews.author: mells_view

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat flimsy but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: With the joycon drift being such an issue, I got this product so that it would be more comfortable playing with a pro controller on the go. Works very well, and like the multiple positions to sit the switch on at different viewing angles. For the price it meets my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Andre Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the switch
customer_reviews.text: This stand is awesome! It’s small and compact and can fit pretty much anywhere. The adjustable angles make it nice for gameplay and the thing I love the most is I can charge my switch while playing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: ... while the kickstand built on to the Switch works fine, the fact that it becomes impossible to charge ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this because while the kickstand built on to the Switch works fine, the fact that it becomes impossible to charge was problematic. Not only does this leave the USB-C port accessible, it locks the Switch in lightly and has nice grips which keeps the Switch steady. Even in an airplane, this stand held the Switch perfectly still and I never felt that it was in danger of collapsing.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Deane

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it advertises! It's also collapsable for storage/transportation. There isn't much to this product. What you see is what you get! Key benefit of this product: enables you to prop up your console so you can charge it while you play on it with wirelessly with your controllers. Yes the Nintendo Switch has a built in stand, but try charging your console while using the built in stand... Yeah, I don't think so!
customer_reviews.author: andoryuu3

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a decent price for an authentic name-brand item! Very simple and easy to use. My daughter's Nintendo Switch Lite fits prefect on it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: It's nice having this in the office at work, instead of having to prop my switch up with something or having it against a wall this lets me have it right in front of me while it charges and i can play while using the pro controller. Nothing crazy
customer_reviews.author: Twizz

customer_reviews.title: Works for switch lite in protective case!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I originally got a different Hori stand to use with the switch lite, but with it being in a case it wouldn't work. So we got this one and it's a perfect fit! Not only does it hold the lite while in the case, it has 3 different settings for angles.
customer_reviews.author: Wilde

customer_reviews.title: I love how the stand folds up neatly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for traveling with my Nintendo Switch. I love how the stand folds up neatly. I can also plug in the charger as I'm using the Switch. At this point, I'd look into Nintendo's Adjustable Charging Stand (so you don't need this and a separate charger), but I'm still happy with this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Solin

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for those with a nintendo switch.
customer_reviews.text: It’s like a collapsible stand which is very convenient especially when traveling you can easily pack it in your purse/bag. Only bad thing is you have to be on a flat surface or it’ll fold.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Little Switch Holder
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sturdy and appealing Switch holder. Nothing complicated about its design. It simply holds your Switch when not connected to a T.V. and when your wrist need a break. Word of advise, it is not as sturdy when lifted so for the sake of your console separate them and set the stand first before placing your Switch. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: it's mostly pretty good if you have a solid surface to place ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this a while now, it's mostly pretty good if you have a solid surface to place it on. For me I lay in bed and play I use a book but its not real well balanced so it tends to tip over, like if I move slightly or breathe in and out deep. Works best at a table.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my three year old
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! We purchased this for our toddler and it works great. It has three notches so you can easily adjust the height/angle of the device to your preference.
customer_reviews.author: SKnapp2417

customer_reviews.title: Could be cheaper
customer_reviews.text: It is simple and effective. Kinda expensive for what it is but if you want a nice looking solution to adjust the Switch screen position while on tabletop mode and also be able to recharge it while playing, this is it. The plastic feels almost cheap but seems to be sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno S.

product_meta.title: HORI Compact Playstand for Nintendo Switch Officially Licensed by Nintendo
product_meta.description: Officially Licensed by Nintendo. Enjoy playing your Nintendo Switch at the perfect angle with the Compact PlayStand by HORI! Folds out to hold the Nintendo Switch at an adjustable angle, secured in place by rubber grips. Includes a space for the charging cable to connect so you can charge while playing! Folds up for easy portability. Nintendo Switch and charging cable not included.
feature_bullets: Play while charging in angled stand

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,286 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
